LegalRights.Description: You have the right to express your opinions and ideas freely, as long as it does not incite violence or hatred.
You have the right to privacy in your personal life, home, and correspondence. Your personal information should be protected.
You have the right to a fair and impartial trial if you are accused of a crime. This includes the right to legal representation.
You should not be discriminated against based on your race, gender, religion, disability, or other protected characteristics.

LegalRights.Category: Freedom from Torture and Cruel Treatment
LegalRights.Description: You have the right not to be subjected to torture or cruel, inhuman, or degrading treatment or punishment.
You have the right to access education without discrimination. Education should be available, accessible, and of good quality.
You have the right to work in a safe and healthy environment, with fair wages and reasonable working hours.
You have the right to practice, change, or have no religion, and your beliefs should be respected.
You have the right to the highest attainable standard of physical and mental health, including access to healthcare services.
You have the right to peacefully assemble and form associations or organizations, including political parties and trade unions.
You have the right to own, use, and dispose of property. Private property should not be taken without just compensation.
Children have special rights, including the right to protection, education, and participation in decisions affecting them.
Men and women should receive equal pay for equal work or work of equal value, without discrimination.
